attributes.name: Ember.EnumerableUtils
attributes.description:
Defines some convenience methods for working with Enumerables.
`Ember.EnumerableUtils` uses `Ember.ArrayPolyfills` when necessary.

methods.description:
Used internally to allow changing properties in a backwards compatible way, and print a helpful
deprecation warning.
methods.name: deprecateProperty

params.name: object
params.description: The object to add the deprecated property to.

params.name: deprecatedKey
params.description: The property to add (and print deprecation warnings upon accessing).

params.name: newKey
params.description: The property that will be aliased.

methods.description:
Calls the map function on the passed object with a specified callback. This
uses `Ember.ArrayPolyfill`'s-map method when necessary.
methods.name: map

params.name: obj
params.description: The object that should be mapped

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to execute

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing *callback*

methods.description:
Calls the forEach function on the passed object with a specified callback. This
uses `Ember.ArrayPolyfill`'s-forEach method when necessary.
methods.name: forEach

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to call forEach on

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to execute

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing *callback*

methods.description:
Calls the filter function on the passed object with a specified callback. This
uses `Ember.ArrayPolyfill`'s-filter method when necessary.
methods.name: filter

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to call filter on

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to execute

params.name: thisArg
params.description: Value to use as this when executing *callback*

return.description: An array containing the filtered values

methods.description:
Calls the indexOf function on the passed object with a specified callback. This
uses `Ember.ArrayPolyfill`'s-indexOf method when necessary.
methods.name: indexOf

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to call indexOn on

params.name: index
params.description: The index to start searching from

methods.description:
Returns an array of indexes of the first occurrences of the passed elements
on the passed object.

```javascript
 var array = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];
 Ember.EnumerableUtils.indexesOf(array, [2, 5]); // [1, 4]

 var fubar = "Fubarr";
 Ember.EnumerableUtils.indexesOf(fubar, ['b', 'r']); // [2, 4]
```
methods.name: indexesOf

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to check for element indexes

params.name: elements
params.description: The elements to search for on *obj*

methods.description:
Adds an object to an array. If the array already includes the object this
method has no effect.
methods.name: addObject

params.name: array
params.description: The array the passed item should be added to

params.name: item
params.description: The item to add to the passed array

methods.description:
Removes an object from an array. If the array does not contain the passed
object this method has no effect.
methods.name: removeObject

params.name: array
params.description: The array to remove the item from.

params.name: item
params.description: The item to remove from the passed array.

methods.name: replace

params.name: array
params.description: The array the objects should be inserted into.

params.name: idx
params.description:
Starting index in the array to replace. If *idx* >=
length, then append to the end of the array.

params.name: amt
params.description:
Number of elements that should be removed from the array,
starting at *idx*

params.name: objects
params.description:
An array of zero or more objects that should be
inserted into the array at *idx*

methods.name: intersection

params.name: array1
params.description: The first array

params.name: array2
params.description: The second array

return.description: The intersection of the two passed arrays.
